  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 118

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SSNHL) is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: SSNHL is defined as ≥30 dB loss at one frequency occurring over 7 days

options.label: B
options.text: Spontaneous recovery occurs in over 90% of idiopathic cases within 2 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Intratympanic steroid therapy helps increase local steroid levels with fewer systemic side effects

options.label: D
options.text: The presence of vertigo is associated with a better prognosis in SSNHL

questions.correct_answer: C. Intratympanic steroid therapy helps increase local steroid levels with fewer systemic side effects
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Intratympanic steroid therapy helps increase local steroid levels with fewer systemic side effects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intratympanic steroid therapy in SSNHL improves cochlear drug delivery while minimizing systemic side effects, making it effective in selected patients.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 36
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 36

questions.text: Which of the following features is most suggestive of positional nystagmus of peripheral origin?

options.label: A
options.text: No latency, non-fatiguable, direction changing

options.label: B
options.text: Latency of 2–20 seconds, duration less than 1 minute, direction fixed toward under ear

options.label: C
options.text: Latency absent, duration less than 30 seconds, direction changing

options.label: D
options.text: Direction of nystagmus changes with head position and is associated with no vertigo

questions.correct_answer: B. Latency of 2–20 seconds, duration less than 1 minute, direction fixed toward under ear
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Latency of 2–20 seconds, duration less than 1 minute, direction fixed toward under ear

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Peripheral positional nystagmus is characterized by a latency of 2–20 seconds, short duration (<1 minute), fixed direction toward the undermost ear, and is fatiguable with severe vertigo.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 42
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 42

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Electrocochleography (EcoG) is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: EcoG is primarily used to measure brainstem auditory responses occurring after 10 ms

options.label: B
options.text: Summating potential to action potential (SP/AP) ratio above 30% is suggestive of Ménière’s disease

options.label: C
options.text: The recording electrode is placed on the scalp in all cases

options.label: D
options.text: Sedation interferes with the reliability of EcoG in children

questions.correct_answer: B. Summating potential to action potential (SP/AP) ratio above 30% is suggestive of Ménière’s disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Summating potential to action potential (SP/AP) ratio above 30% is suggestive of Ménière’s disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Electrocochleography detects inner ear and auditory nerve responses within 5 ms, and an SP/AP ratio >30% is suggestive of Ménière’s disease.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 26
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 26

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Visual Reinforcement Audiometry (VRA) is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: VRA is best suited for children above 3 years of age

options.label: B
options.text: VRA involves conditioning the child to turn toward sound, reinforced by visual stimuli like flashing lights or animated toys

options.label: C
options.text: VRA uses only bone conduction testing as headphones are not well tolerated by infants

options.label: D
options.text: VRA cannot determine hearing thresholds using standard audiometric techniques

questions.correct_answer: B. VRA involves conditioning the child to turn toward sound, reinforced by visual stimuli like flashing lights or animated toys
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) VRA involves conditioning the child to turn toward sound, reinforced by visual stimuli like flashing lights or animated toys

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Visual Reinforcement Audiometry (VRA) is used in children aged 6 months to 2 years to assess hearing by conditioning head-turning responses to sound, reinforced with visual stimuli.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 118
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 118

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the management of hearing-impaired children is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Manual communication is preferred over auditory-oral methods in post lingually deaf children

options.label: B
options.text: Vibrotactile aids are used to amplify sound in children with mild hearing loss

options.label: C
options.text: Total communication involves auditory, visual, tactile, and kinesthetic inputs to develop multiple communication modes

options.label: D
options.text: Hearing aids should be avoided in children with residual hearing to prevent auditory overload

questions.correct_answer: C. Total communication involves auditory, visual, tactile, and kinesthetic inputs to develop multiple communication modes
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Total communication involves auditory, visual, tactile, and kinesthetic inputs to develop multiple communication modes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Total communication in hearing-impaired children involves using auditory, visual, tactile, and kinesthetic methods to promote comprehensive language development.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 120
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 120

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding hearing assessment in infants is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Otoacoustic emissions (OAEs) are absent in VIIIth nerve neuropathy

options.label: B
options.text: Auditory brainstem response (ABR) is considered normal in infants if response is seen at 60 dB nHL

options.label: C
options.text: OAEs may be absent due to middle ear effusion or canal debris in the first few days after birth

options.label: D
options.text: Arousal test is performed when the infant is fully awake and alert

questions.correct_answer: C. OAEs may be absent due to middle ear effusion or canal debris in the first few days after birth
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) OAEs may be absent due to middle ear effusion or canal debris in the first few days after birth

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In neonates, OAEs may be absent due to middle ear effusion or canal debris despite normal cochlear function, highlighting the need for careful interpretation in early screening.

  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 118

questions.text: Which of the following combinations provides the maximum hearing attenuation against environmental noise?

options.label: A
options.text: Cotton wool

options.label: B
options.text: Ear plugs alone

options.label: C
options.text: Ear muffs alone

Ans. D) Combination of ear plugs and ear muffs

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the cold-air caloric test is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is preferred over water caloric testing in patients with intact tympanic membranes

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It is a qualitative vestibular test using cooled air through a Dundas Grant tube

Ans. D) It is a qualitative vestibular test using cooled air through a Dundas Grant tube

  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 43

questions.text: Which of the following statements about vestibular nystagmus is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Nystagmus due to purulent labyrinthitis typically beats toward the affected side

options.label: B
options.text: Nystagmus from central causes is suppressed by optic fixation

options.label: C
options.text: Vertical downbeat nystagmus suggests a lesion in the craniocervical region such as Arnold–Chiari malformation

options.label: D
options.text: Peripheral vestibular nystagmus is purely torsional and disconjugate

questions.correct_answer: C. Vertical downbeat nystagmus suggests a lesion in the craniocervical region such as Arnold–Chiari malformation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vertical downbeat nystagmus suggests a lesion in the craniocervical region such as Arnold–Chiari malformation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vertical downbeat nystagmus is characteristic of central vestibular pathology, particularly lesions at the craniocervical junction such as Arnold–Chiari malformation.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 41
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 41

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the development of the membranous inner ear is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The inner ear develops from endoderm near the first pharyngeal pouch

options.label: B
options.text: The saccule and cochlea (pars superior) develop earlier than the semicircular canals and utricle

options.label: C
options.text: The auditory placode gives rise to the otocyst, which forms the membranous labyrinth

options.label: D
options.text: Development of external, middle, and inner ear structures occurs simultaneously and symmetrically

questions.correct_answer: C. The auditory placode gives rise to the otocyst, which forms the membranous labyrinth
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The auditory placode gives rise to the otocyst, which forms the membranous labyrinth

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The auditory placode forms the otocyst, which differentiates into the membranous labyrinth including endolymphatic structures, with pars superior (utricle and semicircular canals) developing earlier than pars inferior (saccule and cochlea).
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 12.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 12.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding cochlear and auditory nerve potentials is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Endocochlear potential is an AC potential generated by hair cell movement during sound stimulation

options.label: B
options.text: Cochlear microphonic is a DC potential that does not require an external sound stimulus

options.label: C
options.text: Summating potential is a receptor potential that follows the envelope of the sound stimulus and may aid in diagnosing Ménière’s disease

options.label: D
options.text: Compound action potential is a graded potential with no latency and no refractory period

questions.correct_answer: C. Summating potential is a receptor potential that follows the envelope of the sound stimulus and may aid in diagnosing Ménière’s disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Summating potential is a receptor potential that follows the envelope of the sound stimulus and may aid in diagnosing Ménière’s disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The summating potential is a DC receptor potential generated by hair cells, follows the sound envelope, and is useful in diagnosing Ménière’s disease.
  • ➤ summating potential
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding central vestibular connections is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Vestibular nuclei receive afferents only from the peripheral vestibular apparatus

options.label: B
options.text: Efferents from vestibular nuclei to cranial nerves III, IV, VI mediate auditory reflexes

options.label: C
options.text: Vestibulospinal fibres help maintain posture by coordinating head, neck, and body movements

options.label: D
options.text: Subjective awareness of motion is mediated via projections to the occipital cortex

questions.correct_answer: C. Vestibulospinal fibres help maintain posture by coordinating head, neck, and body movements
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vestibulospinal fibres help maintain posture by coordinating head, neck, and body movements

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vestibulospinal fibres from the vestibular nuclei coordinate head, neck, and body movements to maintain posture and balance.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 17
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 17

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the vestibular system and semicircular canals is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Stimulation of the posterior semicircular canal results in horizontal nystagmus

options.label: B
options.text: Ampullopetal flow is less effective than ampullofugal flow in the horizontal canal

options.label: C
options.text: Nystagmus is always in the same direction as endolymph flow in the semicircular canals

options.label: D
options.text: Semicircular canals detect angular acceleration, while utricle and saccule respond to linear acceleration and gravity

questions.correct_answer: D. Semicircular canals detect angular acceleration, while utricle and saccule respond to linear acceleration and gravity
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Semicircular canals detect angular acceleration, while utricle and saccule respond to linear acceleration and gravity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Semicircular canals detect angular acceleration, while the utricle and saccule respond to linear acceleration, head tilt, and gravitational forces for maintaining equilibrium.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 17
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 17

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the vestibular system is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Cristae in the semicircular ducts respond to linear acceleration and head tilt

options.label: B
options.text: Macula of the utricle lies vertically and responds to angular acceleration

options.label: C
options.text: Otolithic membrane contains calcium carbonate crystals and helps detect gravity and linear motion

options.label: D
options.text: Scarpa’s ganglion contains multipolar neurons and lies in the medial part of the internal auditory canal

questions.correct_answer: C. Otolithic membrane contains calcium carbonate crystals and helps detect gravity and linear motion
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Otolithic membrane contains calcium carbonate crystals and helps detect gravity and linear motion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The otolithic membrane in the macula contains calcium carbonate crystals (otoconia) that respond to gravity and linear acceleration by stimulating the underlying hair cells.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 16
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 16

questions.text: Based on the development timeline of ear structures, which of the following completes its development latest during fetal life?

options.label: A
options.text: Pinna

options.label: B
options.text: External auditory meatus

options.label: C
options.text: Cochlea

options.label: D
options.text: Middle ear

questions.correct_answer: D. Middle ear
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Middle ear

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Among the ear structures, the middle ear completes its development last—by the 30th week of gestation.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 12
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 12

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the auditory neural pathway is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Spiral ganglion is located in the modiolus of the cochlea and contains multipolar neurons

options.label: B
options.text: The auditory cortex is located in the inferior frontal gyrus (Brodmann area 4)

options.label: C
options.text: Each ear is represented only in the contralateral cerebral hemisphere

options.label: D
options.text: The axons of bipolar neurons in the spiral ganglion form the cochlear nerve and terminate in the dorsal and ventral cochlear nuclei

questions.correct_answer: D. The axons of bipolar neurons in the spiral ganglion form the cochlear nerve and terminate in the dorsal and ventral cochlear nuclei
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) The axons of bipolar neurons in the spiral ganglion form the cochlear nerve and terminate in the dorsal and ventral cochlear nuclei

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cochlear nerve arises from bipolar neurons in the spiral ganglion and projects to the dorsal and ventral cochlear nuclei, with the auditory pathway ascending bilaterally through E. COLI-MA to the auditory cortex in Brodmann area 41.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the Organ of Corti is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Outer hair cells are primarily responsible for transmitting auditory impulses via afferent fibers

options.label: B
options.text: Inner hair cells are arranged in multiple rows and receive efferent innervation from the olivary complex

options.label: C
options.text: The shearing movement between the tectorial membrane and hair cells stimulates auditory transduction

options.label: D
options.text: Deiters’ cells support inner hair cells and lie medial to the tunnel of Corti

questions.correct_answer: C. The shearing movement between the tectorial membrane and hair cells stimulates auditory transduction
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The shearing movement between the tectorial membrane and hair cells stimulates auditory transduction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The shearing force between the tectorial membrane and hair cells in the Organ of Corti is responsible for initiating auditory transduction.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 13

questions.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the fluid compartments of the internal ear (labyrinth)?

options.label: A
options.text: Both the bony and membranous labyrinth are filled with perilymph

options.label: B
options.text: The membranous labyrinth is filled with perilymph and lies within the endolymph-filled bony labyrinth

options.label: C
options.text: The membranous labyrinth is filled with endolymph, and the space between it and the bony labyrinth contains perilymph

options.label: D
options.text: The bony labyrinth is filled with endolymph and surrounds the perilymph-filled membranous labyrinth

questions.correct_answer: C. The membranous labyrinth is filled with endolymph, and the space between it and the bony labyrinth contains perilymph
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The membranous labyrinth is filled with endolymph, and the space between it and the bony labyrinth contains perilymph

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The membranous labyrinth of the internal ear contains endolymph, while the space between it and the surrounding bony labyrinth contains perilymph.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 9
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 9

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the internal ear is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Scala media is filled with perilymph and communicates with scala tympani via helicotrema

options.label: B
options.text: The utricle is located anterior to the saccule and receives input from the ductus reuniens

options.label: C
options.text: The basilar membrane is widest at the base, hence low-frequency sounds are heard there

options.label: D
options.text: Endolymphatic sac lies between layers of dura and is a surgical target in Ménière’s disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Endolymphatic sac lies between layers of dura and is a surgical target in Ménière’s disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Endolymphatic sac lies between layers of dura and is a surgical target in Ménière’s disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The endolymphatic sac lies between layers of dura on the petrous bone and is surgically accessed in Ménière’s disease for decompression or shunting. Openings and lodges both the saccule and utricle.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 9.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 9.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding posturography is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used to evaluate only the vestibular component of balance control

options.label: B
options.text: It relies on altering visual, vestibular, and somatosensory inputs to assess postural stability

options.label: C
options.text: It provides definitive diagnosis of vestibular disorders

options.label: D
options.text: Posturography must be performed with a moving platform only

questions.correct_answer: B. It relies on altering visual, vestibular, and somatosensory inputs to assess postural stability
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It relies on altering visual, vestibular, and somatosensory inputs to assess postural stability

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Posturography assesses postural stability by evaluating the integration of visual, vestibular, and somatosensory inputs through fixed or moving platforms.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 44
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 44

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV) is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: BPPV is commonly associated with persistent hearing loss and tinnitus

options.label: B
options.text: The Dix-Hallpike manoeuvre is used to treat BPPV by dislodging otoconia from the semicircular canal

options.label: C
options.text: Epley’s manoeuvre repositions otoconial debris from the posterior semicircular canal into the utricle

options.label: D
options.text: Vertigo in BPPV is non-fatiguable and gets worse with repeated testing

questions.correct_answer: C. Epley’s manoeuvre repositions otoconial debris from the posterior semicircular canal into the utricle
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Epley’s manoeuvre repositions otoconial debris from the posterior semicircular canal into the utricle

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epley’s manoeuvre treats BPPV by repositioning otoconial debris from the posterior semicircular canal back into the utricle.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45

questions.text: Which of the following features is most characteristic of vestibular neuronitis?

options.label: A
options.text: Sudden-onset vertigo associated with tinnitus and hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: Self-limiting vertigo episodes that last from a few seconds to minutes

options.label: C
options.text: Severe vertigo without cochlear symptoms, lasting days to weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Progressive hearing loss with episodic vertigo due to endolymphatic hydrops

questions.correct_answer: C. Severe vertigo without cochlear symptoms, lasting days to weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Severe vertigo without cochlear symptoms, lasting days to weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vestibular neuronitis presents as sudden-onset, prolonged vertigo without cochlear symptoms and is believed to be due to a viral vestibular ganglionitis.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding labyrinthitis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Serous labyrinthitis results in irreversible destruction of cochlear and vestibular function

options.label: B
options.text: Circumscribed labyrinthitis is typically seen in safe type of chronic suppurative otitis media

options.label: C
options.text: Purulent labyrinthitis causes vertigo due to acute vestibular failure with nystagmus toward the affected side

options.label: D
options.text: In circumscribed labyrinthitis, a positive fistula test is usually present due to erosion of the bony labyrinth

questions.correct_answer: D. In circumscribed labyrinthitis, a positive fistula test is usually present due to erosion of the bony labyrinth
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) In circumscribed labyrinthitis, a positive fistula test is usually present due to erosion of the bony labyrinth

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Circumscribed labyrinthitis is commonly seen in unsafe CSOM and is characterized by a positive fistula test due to localized erosion of the bony labyrinth.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding vestibulotoxic drugs is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Streptomycin and gentamicin damage primarily cochlear hair cells

options.label: B
options.text: Metronidazole and nalidixic acid may cause dizziness through vestibular hair cell destruction

options.label: C
options.text: Aminoglycosides like streptomycin primarily damage hair cells of the crista ampullaris

options.label: D
options.text: Vestibular sedatives commonly damage the macula of the utricle

questions.correct_answer: C. Aminoglycosides like streptomycin primarily damage hair cells of the crista ampullaris
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Aminoglycosides like streptomycin primarily damage hair cells of the crista ampullaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aminoglycosides like streptomycin exert vestibulotoxic effects by damaging the hair cells of the crista ampullaris in the vestibular labyrinth.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 45

questions.text: Which of the following statements about vertebrobasilar insufficiency (VBI) as a central vestibular disorder is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Vertigo in VBI is usually prolonged and accompanied by sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: VBI is typically seen in young patients and results from labyrinthine dysfunction

options.label: C
options.text: Cervical osteophytes can precipitate vertigo by compressing vertebral arteries during neck movements

options.label: D
options.text: Vertigo in VBI is always isolated and never associated with other neurological symptoms

questions.correct_answer: C. Cervical osteophytes can precipitate vertigo by compressing vertebral arteries during neck movements
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cervical osteophytes can precipitate vertigo by compressing vertebral arteries during neck movements

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In vertebrobasilar insufficiency, cervical osteophytes may compress vertebral arteries during head rotation or extension, leading to transient vertigo and associated brainstem symptoms.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46

questions.text: Which of the following clinical features is most characteristic of posteroinferior cerebellar artery (PICA) syndrome / Wallenberg syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral facial sensory loss and hemiparesis on the same side

options.label: B
options.text: Vertigo with ipsilateral Horner syndrome and contralateral body sensory loss

options.label: C
options.text: Hearing loss and facial palsy due to pontine infarct

options.label: D
options.text: Pure motor stroke with no cranial nerve involvement

questions.correct_answer: B. Vertigo with ipsilateral Horner syndrome and contralateral body sensory loss
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Vertigo with ipsilateral Horner syndrome and contralateral body sensory loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wallenberg syndrome (PICA infarct) presents with vertigo, ipsilateral Horner syndrome and facial sensory loss, contralateral body sensory loss, and bulbar symptoms like dysphagia and hoarseness.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46

questions.text: Which of the following features is most characteristic of basilar migraine?

options.label: A
options.text: Unilateral throbbing headache with sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: Recurrent occipital headache with vertigo, diplopia, and visual disturbances in adolescent girls

options.label: C
options.text: Persistent hemiparesis with retro-orbital pain in elderly males

options.label: D
options.text: Frontal headache associated with nasal congestion and photophobia

questions.correct_answer: B. Recurrent occipital headache with vertigo, diplopia, and visual disturbances in adolescent girls
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Recurrent occipital headache with vertigo, diplopia, and visual disturbances in adolescent girls

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Basilar migraine presents with recurrent occipital headache, vertigo, diplopia, and visual disturbances, especially in adolescent girls with a positive menstrual and family history.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 46

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding cervical vertigo is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It presents immediately after neck injury and is usually associated with sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: It is aggravated by neck movements and may appear days after cervical trauma

options.label: C
options.text: It results from demyelination of cervical spinal cord and always has neurological deficits

options.label: D
options.text: Diagnosis is confirmed by caloric testing and pure tone audiometry

questions.correct_answer: B. It is aggravated by neck movements and may appear days after cervical trauma
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It is aggravated by neck movements and may appear days after cervical trauma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cervical vertigo is a delayed-onset vertigo occurring after neck injury, often triggered by neck movement and associated with cervical muscle spasm and tenderness.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 47
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 47

questions.text: Which of the following is the most characteristic combination of features in Ménière’s disease (endolymphatic hydrops)?

options.label: A
options.text: Vertigo, conductive hearing loss, otalgia, and ear discharge

options.label: B
options.text: Vertigo, sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness

options.label: C
options.text: Positional vertigo, normal hearing, and no tinnitus

options.label: D
options.text: Episodic vertigo with immediate resolution, no hearing involvement

questions.correct_answer: B. Vertigo, sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Vertigo, sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ménière’s disease is characterized by episodic vertigo, sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness due to endolymphatic hydrops in the inner ear.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100

questions.text: Which of the following mechanisms is most commonly implicated in the pathogenesis of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Excessive perilymph production by the cochlear aqueduct

options.label: B
options.text: Defective absorption of endolymph by the endolymphatic sac

options.label: C
options.text: Overstimulation of semicircular canals due to otoconia

options.label: D
options.text: Hypersecretion of endolymph by the perilymphatic sac

questions.correct_answer: B. Defective absorption of endolymph by the endolymphatic sac
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Defective absorption of endolymph by the endolymphatic sac

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most accepted cause of Ménière’s disease is defective absorption of endolymph by the endolymphatic sac, leading to endolymphatic hydrops and the classical triad of vertigo, hearing loss, and tinnitus.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100

questions.text: Which of the following clinical features is most characteristic of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Persistent high-frequency hearing loss with purulent ear discharge

options.label: B
options.text: Episodic vertigo, fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness

options.label: C
options.text: Continuous rotational vertigo with bilateral conductive hearing loss

options.label: D
options.text: Vertigo worsened by change in head position with normal hearing

questions.correct_answer: B. Episodic vertigo, fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Episodic vertigo, fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, and aural fullness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ménière’s disease typically presents with episodic vertigo, fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, low-pitched tinnitus, and aural fullness due to endolymphatic hydrops.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100

questions.text: Which of the following investigative findings is most characteristic of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: SISI score less than 15% and negative recruitment test

options.label: B
options.text: Conductive hearing loss with a downward-sloping audiogram

options.label: C
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss with rising audiogram in early stages and SP/AP ratio >30% on electrocochleography

options.label: D
options.text: Persistent spontaneous nystagmus toward the affected ear with reduced bone conduction

questions.correct_answer: C. Sensorineural hearing loss with rising audiogram in early stages and SP/AP ratio >30% on electrocochleography
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Sensorineural hearing loss with rising audiogram in early stages and SP/AP ratio >30% on electrocochleography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Ménière’s disease, early audiometry shows low-frequency SNHL (rising curve) and electrocochleography reveals an SP/AP ratio >30%, supporting the diagnosis of endolymphatic hydrops.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 100

questions.text: Which of the following test findings best supports a diagnosis of a retrocochlear lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss with SISI score >70%, normal BERA, and preserved stapedial reflex

options.label: B
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss with absent recruitment, tone decay >25 dB, and delayed wave V in BERA

options.label: C
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss with recruitment present, SISI score >70%, and normal stapedial reflex

options.label: D
options.text: Normal hearing, speech discrimination score 95%, and BERA showing normal wave I-V interval

questions.correct_answer: B. Sensorineural hearing loss with absent recruitment, tone decay >25 dB, and delayed wave V in BERA
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Sensorineural hearing loss with absent recruitment, tone decay >25 dB, and delayed wave V in BERA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A retrocochlear lesion is characterized by absent recruitment, poor SISI (<20%), tone decay >25 dB, and delayed or absent wave V in BERA.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102

questions.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes a variant of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Vestibular hydrops is characterized by recurrent hearing loss without vertigo

options.label: B
options.text: In drop attacks (Tumarkin's crisis), patients experience vertigo followed by unconsciousness

options.label: C
options.text: Lermoyez syndrome presents with hearing deterioration followed by vertigo with improvement in hearing

options.label: D
options.text: Cochlear hydrops is associated with episodic vertigo and normal hearing throughout

questions.correct_answer: C. Lermoyez syndrome presents with hearing deterioration followed by vertigo with improvement in hearing
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lermoyez syndrome presents with hearing deterioration followed by vertigo with improvement in hearing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lermoyez syndrome is a variant of Ménière’s disease where hearing loss precedes vertigo, and hearing improves following the vertigo attack.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102

questions.text: Which of the following best differentiates Ménière’s disease from Ménière’s syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Ménière’s disease is always bilateral, while the syndrome is unilateral

options.label: B
options.text: Ménière’s syndrome is idiopathic, while Ménière’s disease has a known cause

options.label: C
options.text: Ménière’s disease is idiopathic, while Ménière’s syndrome is secondary to an identifiable cause

options.label: D
options.text: Both are caused by trauma but differ in severity of vertigo

questions.correct_answer: C. Ménière’s disease is idiopathic, while Ménière’s syndrome is secondary to an identifiable cause
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ménière’s disease is idiopathic, while Ménière’s syndrome is secondary to an identifiable cause

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ménière’s disease is idiopathic, while Ménière’s syndrome refers to similar clinical features arising from identifiable causes such as trauma, infection, or autoimmune conditions.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 102

questions.text: According to the American Academy of Otolaryngology–Head and Neck Surgery (AAOHNS), which of the following criteria best defines a "Definite" diagnosis of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: One episode of vertigo with audiometrically confirmed hearing loss and tinnitus

options.label: B
options.text: Two or more episodes of vertigo lasting more than 20 minutes, hearing loss on audiometry, tinnitus or fullness, and exclusion of other causes

options.label: C
options.text: Histopathological confirmation of endolymphatic hydrops

options.label: D
options.text: Episodic vertigo with no documented hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: B. Two or more episodes of vertigo lasting more than 20 minutes, hearing loss on audiometry, tinnitus or fullness, and exclusion of other causes
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Two or more episodes of vertigo lasting more than 20 minutes, hearing loss on audiometry, tinnitus or fullness, and exclusion of other causes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ "Definite" Ménière’s disease is diagnosed when a patient has ≥2 spontaneous vertigo episodes ≥20 minutes, documented hearing loss, tinnitus or fullness, and no other identifiable cause.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103

questions.text: Which of the following general measures is not typically recommended in the conservative management of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Advising the patient to avoid smoking and excess caffeine

options.label: B
options.text: Encouraging a low salt diet with sodium intake <2 g/day

options.label: C
options.text: Recommending high water intake to improve endolymph drainage

options.label: D
options.text: Advising patients to avoid activities requiring precise balance like flying or underwater diving

questions.correct_answer: C. Recommending high water intake to improve endolymph drainage
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Recommending high water intake to improve endolymph drainage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Conservative management of Ménière’s disease includes low salt diet, cessation of smoking and caffeine, stress reduction, and avoiding activities requiring balance—excessive water intake is not recommended.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103

questions.text: Which of the following is not a recommended measure in the acute management of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Administering intravenous diazepam to control vertigo and anxiety

options.label: B
options.text: Advising complete bed rest with head supported to minimize head movement

options.label: C
options.text: Encouraging the patient to walk periodically to regain vestibular compensation

options.label: D
options.text: Using vestibular suppressants like promethazine or dimenhydrinate via IM/IV route

questions.correct_answer: C. Encouraging the patient to walk periodically to regain vestibular compensation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Encouraging the patient to walk periodically to regain vestibular compensation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acute attacks of Ménière’s disease are managed with reassurance, bed rest, vestibular suppressants, and vasodilators—movement should be minimized during the episode.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 103

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the chronic phase management of Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Betahistine acts by reducing cochlear fluid via inhibition of endolymph production

options.label: B
options.text: Vestibular suppressants like prochlorperazine are continued lifelong to prevent attacks

options.label: C
options.text: Elimination of allergens and correction of hormonal imbalances can help in preventing recurrent episodes

options.label: D
options.text: Furosemide should be used daily without potassium supplementation to maintain labyrinthine fluid balance

questions.correct_answer: C. Elimination of allergens and correction of hormonal imbalances can help in preventing recurrent episodes
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Elimination of allergens and correction of hormonal imbalances can help in preventing recurrent episodes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the chronic phase of Ménière’s disease, identifying allergens and correcting hormonal imbalances (like hypothyroidism) play an important role in preventing recurrences.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104

questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct regarding intratympanic gentamicin therapy for Ménière’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Gentamicin is primarily cochleotoxic and commonly causes high-frequency SNHL

options.label: B
options.text: Microwick delivers drugs to the oval window through the tympanic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Gentamicin therapy offers good vertigo control but carries a risk of hearing loss

options.label: D
options.text: Tympanostomy tube is inserted into the round window to allow Microwick placement

questions.correct_answer: C. Gentamicin therapy offers good vertigo control but carries a risk of hearing loss
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gentamicin therapy offers good vertigo control but carries a risk of hearing loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intratympanic gentamicin therapy is vestibulotoxic and provides effective vertigo control in Ménière’s disease but carries a significant risk of hearing loss.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104

questions.text: Which of the following surgical procedures for Ménière’s disease is considered destructive and results in complete loss of cochlear and vestibular function?

options.label: A
options.text: Endolymphatic sac decompression

options.label: B
options.text: Section of vestibular nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Labyrinthectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Cochleosacculotomy

questions.correct_answer: C. Labyrinthectomy
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Labyrinthectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Labyrinthectomy is a destructive surgical treatment for Ménière’s disease that eliminates both vestibular and cochlear function and is used only when hearing is not salvageable.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Meniett device therapy in the management of Ménière’s disease is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It delivers intermittent high-frequency electrical pulses directly to the cochlea

options.label: B
options.text: Myringotomy and ventilation tube insertion are required before using the device

options.label: C
options.text: The therapy is reserved for emergency control of acute vertigo episodes

options.label: D
options.text: It permanently destroys the vestibular labyrinth to control vertigo

questions.correct_answer: B. Myringotomy and ventilation tube insertion are required before using the device
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Myringotomy and ventilation tube insertion are required before using the device

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meniett device therapy delivers low-pressure pulses to the inner ear via a ventilation tube placed after myringotomy and is used in chronic Ménière’s disease cases unresponsive to medical treatment.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding acoustic neuroma (vestibular schwannoma) is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It most commonly arises from the cochlear division of the 8th cranial nerve

options.label: B
options.text: It is a rapidly growing, malignant tumor of the cerebellopontine angle

options.label: C
options.text: Bilateral tumors are commonly seen in sporadic cases of acoustic neuroma

options.label: D
options.text: It is a benign tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular nerve and grows slowly

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a benign tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular nerve and grows slowly
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) It is a benign tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular nerve and grows slowly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acoustic neuroma is a benign, slow-growing tumor arising from Schwann cells of the vestibular division of the VIII cranial nerve and may be bilateral in neurofibromatosis.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112

questions.text: Which of the following clinical features is most characteristic of acoustic neuroma?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral conductive hearing loss with tinnitus

options.label: B
options.text: Sudden onset vertigo with bilateral nystagmus

options.label: C
options.text: Unilateral progressive sensorineural hearing loss with impaired speech discrimination

options.label: D
options.text: Facial nerve palsy as an early symptom

questions.correct_answer: C. Unilateral progressive sensorineural hearing loss with impaired speech discrimination
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Unilateral progressive sensorineural hearing loss with impaired speech discrimination

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acoustic neuroma typically presents with unilateral progressive sensorineural hearing loss and disproportionately poor speech discrimination.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112

questions.text: Which of the following is considered the gold standard investigation for diagnosing an intracanalicular acoustic neuroma?

options.label: A
options.text: Pure tone audiometry

options.label: B
options.text: CT scan with contrast

options.label: C
options.text: MRI with gadolinium contrast

options.label: D
options.text: Evoked response audiometry (BERA)

questions.correct_answer: C. MRI with gadolinium contrast
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) MRI with gadolinium contrast

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MRI with gadolinium contrast is the gold standard for detecting intracanalicular acoustic neuroma.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 113
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 113

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the treatment of acoustic neuroma is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Conventional radiotherapy is the primary treatment of choice for all acoustic neuromas.

options.label: B
options.text: Middle cranial fossa approach is preferred for large tumours with non-serviceable hearing.

options.label: C
options.text: Gamma knife surgery is a stereotactic radiosurgery used in selected cases of acoustic neuroma.

options.label: D
options.text: Cyber knife requires a rigid frame fixed to the skull during treatment.

questions.correct_answer: C. Gamma knife surgery is a stereotactic radiosurgery used in selected cases of acoustic neuroma.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gamma knife surgery is a stereotactic radiosurgery used in selected cases of acoustic neuroma.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gamma knife stereotactic radiosurgery is a treatment option in patients with acoustic neuroma who are not surgical candidates or have residual tumour.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 114
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 114

questions.text: Which of the following congenital inner ear anomalies is correctly matched with its description?

options.label: A
options.text: Michel Aplasia – Incomplete partitioning of cochlea with preserved petrous apex

options.label: B
options.text: Scheibe Dysplasia – Complete absence of both bony and membranous labyrinth

options.label: C
options.text: Alexander Dysplasia – Affects basal turn of cochlea causing high-frequency hearing loss

options.label: D
options.text: Bing–Siebenmann Dysplasia – Cochleosaccular dysplasia with normal utricle and semicircular canals

questions.correct_answer: C. Alexander Dysplasia – Affects basal turn of cochlea causing high-frequency hearing loss
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Alexander Dysplasia – Affects basal turn of cochlea causing high-frequency hearing loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alexander dysplasia is a congenital inner ear anomaly affecting only the basal turn of the cochlea, resulting in high-frequency hearing loss with preserved low-frequency hearing.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115

questions.text: Which of the following maternal factors is least likely to cause congenital hearing loss in the fetus?

options.label: A
options.text: Rubella infection during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Radiation exposure in the first trimester

options.label: C
options.text: Administration of amikacin during pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Iron supplementation in third trimester

questions.correct_answer: D. Iron supplementation in third trimester
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Iron supplementation in third trimester

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TORCH infections, ototoxic drugs like aminoglycosides, radiation, and maternal metabolic disorders are significant maternal factors associated with congenital hearing loss.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy presents with congenital sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) and has a history of syncopal episodes. ECG shows a prolonged QT interval. Which of the following syndromes is most likely?

options.label: A
options.text: Pendred syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: Waardenburg syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Jervell and Lange-Nielsen syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Usher syndrome

questions.correct_answer: C. Jervell and Lange-Nielsen syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Jervell and Lange-Nielsen syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Jervell and Lange-Nielsen syndrome is an autosomal recessive disorder presenting with congenital SNHL and prolonged QT interval on ECG, often leading to syncopal episodes.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents with progressive sensorineural hearing loss and a history of hereditary nephritis. His family history reveals multiple male relatives with similar complaints. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Treacher-Collins syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: Alport syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Crouzon syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Apert syndrome

questions.correct_answer: B. Alport syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Alport syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alport syndrome presents with progressive sensorineural hearing loss, hereditary nephritis, and corneal dystrophy, typically inherited in an X-linked or autosomal dominant pattern.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presents with branchial fistulas, malformed external ears with preauricular pits, and renal anomalies. Audiometry reveals mixed hearing loss. Which of the following syndromes is most likely?

options.label: A
options.text: Stickler syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: Klippel-Feil syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Branchio-oto-renal syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Wildervanck syndrome

questions.correct_answer: C. Branchio-oto-renal syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Branchio-oto-renal syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Branchio-oto-renal syndrome presents with conductive or mixed hearing loss, branchial cysts or fistulas, malformed external ears with preauricular pits, and renal abnormalities.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116

questions.text: A 4-year-old child with a history of cleft palate and micrognathia presents with sensorineural hearing loss. Examination reveals glossoptosis and features suggestive of Stickler syndrome. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Van der Hoeve syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: Goldenhar syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Down syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Pierre-Robin sequence

questions.correct_answer: D. Pierre-Robin sequence
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Pierre-Robin sequence

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pierre-Robin sequence is characterized by micrognathia, glossoptosis, cleft palate, and hearing loss (SNHL or conductive), and may be part of Stickler syndrome.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 116

questions.text: Which of the following maternal factors is not associated with congenital hearing loss in the fetus?

options.label: A
options.text: Maternal rubella infection during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Use of aminoglycosides like gentamicin during pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Radiation exposure during the first trimester

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of paracetamol during third trimester

questions.correct_answer: D. Administration of paracetamol during third trimester
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Administration of paracetamol during third trimester

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maternal infections (TORCHES), ototoxic drugs (like aminoglycosides), radiation in the first trimester, and maternal illness (e.g., diabetes, alcoholism) are associated with congenital hearing loss in the fetus.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 115

questions.text: Which of the following perinatal conditions is most likely to cause sensorineural hearing loss due to damage to cochlear nuclei?

options.label: A
options.text: Forceps delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Neonatal jaundice with bilirubin >20 mg%

options.label: C
options.text: Use of paracetamol for neonatal fever

options.label: D
options.text: Birth weight of 2.8 kg

questions.correct_answer: B. Neonatal jaundice with bilirubin >20 mg%
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Neonatal jaundice with bilirubin >20 mg%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Perinatal causes like neonatal jaundice with bilirubin >20 mg%, anoxia, prematurity, sepsis, and ototoxic drugs can damage the cochlear nuclei and lead to sensorineural hearing loss.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 117
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 117

questions.text: A 10-year-old child presents with progressive bilateral sensorineural hearing loss. There is a positive family history of deafness. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this child’s hearing loss?

options.label: A
options.text: Secretory otitis media

options.label: B
options.text: Familial progressive sensorineural deafness

options.label: C
options.text: Perilymph fistula following head trauma

options.label: D
options.text: Acute mumps infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Familial progressive sensorineural deafness
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Familial progressive sensorineural deafness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Postnatal genetic causes like familial progressive sensorineural deafness often present in childhood with bilateral progressive SNHL and may occur alone or with syndromes such as Alport or Hurler.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 117
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 117

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents with progressive unilateral hearing loss and imbalance. MRI reveals a well-circumscribed mass at the cerebellopontine angle. Histopathological examination (as shown in the image) reveals spindle-shaped cells arranged in fascicles with alternating hypercellular and hypocellular areas. Which of the following histological features best describes this tumor?

options.label: A
options.text: Antoni A and Antoni B areas with Verocay bodies

options.label: B
options.text: Rosenthal fibers and eosinophilic granular bodies

options.label: C
options.text: Pseudopalisading necrosis

options.label: D
options.text: Whorled pattern with psammoma bodies

questions.correct_answer: A. Antoni A and Antoni B areas with Verocay bodies
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antoni A and Antoni B areas with Verocay bodies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acoustic neuroma shows spindle cells arranged in Antoni A and B areas with Verocay bodies on histology.
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112

questions.text: A 50-year-old patient presents with unilateral hearing loss, decreased corneal reflex, and numbness over the face. On further examination, lacrimation is reduced (confirmed by Schirmer test), and hypoesthesia is noted over the posterior wall of the external auditory canal (Hitselberger sign). As the tumor progresses, the patient also develops ataxia and signs of raised intracranial pressure. Which of the following cranial nerve involvements is correctly matched with the associated sign or test?

options.label: A
options.text: CN V – Loss of taste confirmed by electrogustometry

options.label: B
options.text: CN VII – Hitselberger sign

options.label: C
options.text: CN IX – Decreased corneal sensation

options.label: D
options.text: CN VIII – Dysdiadochokinesia

questions.correct_answer: B. CN VII – Hitselberger sign
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) CN VII – Hitselberger sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hitselberger sign (posterior canal hypoesthesia) is an early indicator of facial nerve (CN VII) involvement in acoustic neuroma.
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 112

questions.text: During endolymphatic sac decompression surgery for Meniere’s disease, a line is drawn in the plane of the lateral semicircular canal and extended posteriorly. This line helps identify the location of the endolymphatic sac. What is the name of this anatomical landmark?

options.label: A
options.text: Krause’s line

options.label: B
options.text: Donaldson’s line

options.label: C
options.text: Trautmann’s triangle

options.label: D
options.text: House–Brackmann line

questions.correct_answer: B. Donaldson’s line
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Donaldson’s line

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Donaldson’s line is the surgical landmark for locating the endolymphatic sac during decompression, drawn along the lateral semicircular canal and extending posteriorly.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 104

questions.text: A NEET-PG aspirant is revising the anatomy of the internal auditory canal (IAC). Which of the following correctly describes the contents and landmarks of the IAC?

options.label: A
options.text: Cochlear nerve lies in the posterosuperior quadrant of the IAC

options.label: B
options.text: Facial nerve lies in the anterosuperior quadrant of the IAC

options.label: C
options.text: Inferior vestibular nerve lies in the anterosuperior quadrant of the IAC

options.label: D
options.text: Bill’s bar separates superior and inferior vestibular nerves

questions.correct_answer: B. Facial nerve lies in the anterosuperior quadrant of the IAC
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Facial nerve lies in the anterosuperior quadrant of the IAC

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Facial nerve lies in the anterosuperior quadrant of the internal auditory canal and is separated from the superior vestibular nerve by Bill’s bar.
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 128
  • ➤ Ref:-P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 128

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Eustachian tube function tests is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Toynbee’s test uses positive pressure to assess Eustachian tube patency

options.label: B
options.text: Saccharine test evaluates the ventilatory function of the Eustachian tube

options.label: C
options.text: Tympanometry evaluates the ability of the tube to equilibrate pressure during swallowing

options.label: D
options.text: Valsalva test should always be used in children to diagnose tube dysfunction

questions.correct_answer: C. Tympanometry evaluates the ability of the tube to equilibrate pressure during swallowing
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Tympanometry evaluates the ability of the tube to equilibrate pressure during swallowing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tympanometry evaluates the Eustachian tube's ability to equilibrate middle ear pressure during swallowing by assessing tympanic membrane compliance.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 59
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 59

questions.text: A 1-year-old child presents with recurrent episodes of otitis media. The pediatrician advises the mother to feed the child in an upright position. What is the most likely anatomical reason for this advice?

options.label: A
options.text: Infant Eustachian tube is narrower and longer

options.label: B
options.text: Infant Eustachian tube is more angulated and rigid

options.label: C
options.text: Infant Eustachian tube is shorter, wider, and more horizontal

options.label: D
options.text: Infant Eustachian tube has more elastic recoil and better closure

questions.correct_answer: C. Infant Eustachian tube is shorter, wider, and more horizontal
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Infant Eustachian tube is shorter, wider, and more horizontal

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infant Eustachian tubes are shorter, wider, and more horizontal, making them prone to regurgitation and otitis media; upright feeding can help prevent this.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 58
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 58

questions.text: Which of the following is not a function of the Eustachian tube?

options.label: A
options.text: Clearance of middle ear secretions via mucociliary action

options.label: B
options.text: Protection of middle ear from nasopharyngeal pressure and secretions

options.label: C
options.text: Equalization of pressure across tympanic membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Continuous drainage of perilymph from the inner ear

questions.correct_answer: D. Continuous drainage of perilymph from the inner ear
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Continuous drainage of perilymph from the inner ear

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Eustachian tube ventilates the middle ear, protects it from nasopharyngeal secretions and pressure, and clears secretions via mucociliary action.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 58
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 58

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the Eustachian tube is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It develops from the first branchial cleft and is 36 cm long

options.label: B
options.text: The isthmus is its widest part and lies at the nasopharyngeal end

options.label: C
options.text: It makes a 45-degree angle with the horizontal and opens into the nasopharynx at the torus tubarius

options.label: D
options.text: It is 24 mm long, entirely cartilaginous, and connects middle ear to oropharynx

questions.correct_answer: C. It makes a 45-degree angle with the horizontal and opens into the nasopharynx at the torus tubarius
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) It makes a 45-degree angle with the horizontal and opens into the nasopharynx at the torus tubarius

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Eustachian tube is 36 mm long, develops from the first pharyngeal pouch, forms a 45° angle with the horizontal, and opens into the nasopharynx at the torus tubarius.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 57
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 57

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman in her third trimester of pregnancy complains of hearing her own voice and breathing sounds loudly in one ear. On otoscopy, tympanic membrane movements are noted with respiration. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Otitis media with effusion

options.label: B
options.text: Patulous Eustachian tube

options.label: C
options.text: Acute Eustachian tube obstruction

options.label: D
options.text: Tympanic membrane perforation

questions.correct_answer: B. Patulous Eustachian tube
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Patulous Eustachian tube

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Patulous Eustachian tube presents with autophony and visible tympanic membrane movement with respiration, and is often seen in pregnancy or after weight loss.
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 57
  • ➤ Ref: P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 57

questions.text: A 6-year-old child is brought by his parents with complaints of poor attention in class and delayed speech development. There is no pain or fever. Otoscopy reveals a dull, retracted tympanic membrane with visible air bubbles behind it. Audiometry shows a conductive hearing loss of around 30 dB. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate myringotomy with grommet insertion

options.label: B
options.text: Empirical antibiotic therapy for 5 days

options.label: C
options.text: Start medical treatment with decongestants and encourage Valsalva manoeuvre

options.label: D
options.text: Cortical mastoidectomy and tympanotomy

questions.correct_answer: C. Start medical treatment with decongestants and encourage Valsalva manoeuvre
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Start medical treatment with decongestants and encourage Valsalva manoeuvre

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Otitis media with effusion in children is managed initially with decongestants, antiallergics, and maneuvers to ventilate the middle ear; surgery is considered if medical management fails.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 65
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 65

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy is brought for a school health check-up. Otoscopic examination reveals a pearly white mass visible behind an intact tympanic membrane, and the child has mild conductive hearing loss. There is no history of ear discharge or previous ear infection. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Acquired cholesteatoma

options.label: B
options.text: Otitis media with effusion

options.label: C
options.text: Congenital cholesteatoma

options.label: D
options.text: Tympanosclerosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Congenital cholesteatoma
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Congenital cholesteatoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Congenital cholesteatoma presents as a white mass behind an intact tympanic membrane and causes conductive hearing loss, commonly discovered incidentally in children.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 67
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 67

questions.text: A 7-year-old child presents with a history of chronic ear discharge, high-grade fever, torticollis, and a tender swelling in the upper part of the neck deep to the sternocleidomastoid muscle. The clinician suspects an abscess arising due to mastoid disease tracking through the mastoid tip. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Postauricular abscess

options.label: B
options.text: Bezold abscess

options.label: C
options.text: Zygomatic abscess

options.label: D
options.text: Luc abscess

questions.correct_answer: B. Bezold abscess
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bezold abscess

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bezold abscess is a deep neck abscess secondary to mastoiditis, characterized by pus tracking from the mastoid tip into the neck, presenting with neck swelling, torticollis, and systemic signs.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 78
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 78

questions.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the comparison between canal wall up and canal wall down mastoidectomy procedures?

options.label: A
options.text: Canal wall up procedure has a lower rate of residual disease and does not require a second-look surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Canal wall down procedure provides a normal meatal appearance and allows unrestricted swimming

options.label: C
options.text: Canal wall up procedure preserves a normal meatus and is better suited for patients requiring hearing aids

options.label: D
options.text: Canal wall down procedure requires second-look surgery to rule out cholesteatoma recurrence

questions.correct_answer: C. Canal wall up procedure preserves a normal meatus and is better suited for patients requiring hearing aids
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Canal wall up procedure preserves a normal meatus and is better suited for patients requiring hearing aids

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Canal wall up mastoidectomy maintains normal meatal anatomy and allows easier use of hearing aids, but has a higher risk of residual disease, while canal wall down is safer for disease clearance but has limitations in swimming and hearing aid fitting.
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 73
  • ➤ Ref:- P.L Dhingra Diseases of Ear Nose and Throat and Head and Neck Surgery 6 th Edition, pg 73

questions.text: A 14-year-old child presents with persistent ear discharge, deep-seated retro-orbital pain, and diplopia. On examination, the child has lateral rectus palsy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute mastoiditis

options.label: B
options.text: Bezold abscess

options.label: C
options.text: Petrositis

options.label: D
options.text: Labyrinthitis

questions.correct_answer: C. Petrositis
questions.explanation:
